definition: Xue Juzheng (912-981), Song historian and compiler of History of the Five Dynasties between Tang and Song 舊五代史|旧五代史
surname Xue/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
wormwood like grass (classical)
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
surname Ju
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
Fang Xuanling (579-648), Tang dynasty historian, compiler of History of Jin dynasty 晉書|晋书
Song Qi (998-1061), Song dynasty poet and writer, coauthor of History of the Later Tang Dynasty 新唐書|新唐书
Sima Guang (1019-1086), politician and historian of Northern Song, author of Comprehensive Mirror for aid in Government 資治通鑒|资治通鉴
Kou Zhun (961-1023), Northern Song politician and poet
Li Fang (925-996), scholar between Tang and Song dynasties, author of fictional history
Liu Xu (887-946), politician in Later Jin of the Five Dynasties 後晉|后晋, compiled History of Early Tang Dynasty 舊唐書|旧唐书
Zhangsun Wuji (c. 594-659), politician and historian of early Tang
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
prime minister (in feudal China)
Wang Qinruo (962-1025), Northern Song dynasty official
Yang Yi (974-1020), Northern Song dynasty writer and poet
Li Song, personal name of eleventh Tang emperor Shunzong 順宗|顺宗[Shun4 zong1] (761-806), reigned 805-806
Li Linfu (-752), Tang politician, chancellor under Tang emperor Xuanzong 玄宗
Wei Zheng (580-643), Tang politician and historian, notorious as a critic, editor of History of the Sui Dynasty 隋書|隋书
Linghu Defen (583-666), Tang dynasty historian, compiler of History of Zhou of the Northern dynasties 周書|周书

Yelü Chucai (1190-1244), Khitan statesman and advisor to Genghis Khan and Ögödei Khan, known for convincing the Mongols to tax the conquered population of the north China plains rather than slaughter it
